subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE SPECIES :
Zumba rhinoidea Peris, 1951
, by original designation
.

NOTES :
Zumba
is restricted to the Afrotropical Region (Pont 1980: 787). The biology, life histories and immature stages are unknown, and no details are provided for the genus by Ferrar (1987).
DISTRIBUTION: Southern Africa: Namibia and South Africa ( Cape , Transvaal).

PREVIOUS RECORD : ( holotype ♂ and paratype ♀ ) S.W. Africa , Mafa and Namakunde [locality unknown],
ii.1923
, (Villeneuve, 1929c: 185); Mafa [locality unknown],
ii.1923
; Warmbad [=Warmquelle nr. Sesfontein] [ 19°17'S , 13°82'E],
ii.1925
; Zesfontein [=Sesfontein] [ 19°13'S , 13°62'E],
ii.1925
; Aus [26°67'S, 16°27'E ],
i.1930
(Zumpt 1958a: 195)
.

NOTES : Biology, life history and immature stages unknown. The species is exceedingly common in Namibia , and has been collected by hand, at UV­light, in yellow, brown, white and blue pans, in pitfall and Malaise traps and by sweeping a flowering bush. Occurring at high elevations on the Brandberg ( 700 m , 1180 m , 1200 m , 1820 m , 1960 m , 2000 m ). The distribution pattern of this species indicates a preference for the hyper­arid region of Namibia ; occurring in all Namibian biomes, but principally in the desert and succulent karoo biomes ( Fig. 102 ). Recorded in all months of the year, except June; most abundantly from November to February ( vide Table 2 ).
